005package edu.wpi.first.math.kinematics;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond;
008import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.RadiansPerSecond;
009
010import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUsageId;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Rotation2d;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Twist2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.units.Angle;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.Distance;
017import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
018import edu.wpi.first.units.Velocity;
019import java.util.Arrays;
020import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
021
022/**
023 * Helper class that converts a chassis velocity (dx, dy, and dtheta components) into individual
024 * module states (speed and angle).
025 *
026 * <p>The inverse kinematics (converting from a desired chassis velocity to individual module
027 * states) uses the relative locations of the modules with respect to the center of rotation. The
028 * center of rotation for inverse kinematics is also variable. This means that you can set your
029 * center of rotation in a corner of the robot to perform special evasion maneuvers.
030 *
031 * <p>Forward kinematics (converting an array of module states into the overall chassis motion) is
032 * performs the exact opposite of what inverse kinematics does. Since this is an overdetermined
033 * system (more equations than variables), we use a least-squares approximation.
034 *
035 * <p>The inverse kinematics: [moduleStates] = [moduleLocations] * [chassisSpeeds] We take the
036 * Moore-Penrose pseudoinverse of [moduleLocations] and then multiply by [moduleStates] to get our
037 * chassis speeds.
038 *
039 * <p>Forward kinematics is also used for odometry -- determining the position of the robot on the
040 * field using encoders and a gyro.
041 */
042@SuppressWarnings("overrides")
043public class SwerveDriveKinematics
044    implements Kinematics<SwerveModuleState[], SwerveModulePosition[]> {
045  private final SimpleMatrix m_inverseKinematics;
046  private final SimpleMatrix m_forwardKinematics;
047
048  private final int m_numModules;
049  private final Translation2d[] m_modules;
050  private Rotation2d[] m_moduleHeadings;
051  private Translation2d m_prevCoR = Translation2d.kZero;
052
053  /**
054   * Constructs a swerve drive kinematics object. This takes in a variable number of module
055   * locations as Translation2d objects. The order in which you pass in the module locations is the
056   * same order that you will receive the module states when performing inverse kinematics. It is
057   * also expected that you pass in the module states in the same order when calling the forward
058   * kinematics methods.
059   *
060   * @param moduleTranslationsMeters The locations of the modules relative to the physical center of
061   *     the robot.
062   */
063  public SwerveDriveKinematics(Translation2d... moduleTranslationsMeters) {
064    if (moduleTranslationsMeters.length < 2) {
065      throw new IllegalArgumentException("A swerve drive requires at least two modules");
066    }
067    m_numModules = moduleTranslationsMeters.length;
068    m_modules = Arrays.copyOf(moduleTranslationsMeters, m_numModules);
069    m_moduleHeadings = new Rotation2d[m_numModules];
070    Arrays.fill(m_moduleHeadings, Rotation2d.kZero);
071    m_inverseKinematics = new SimpleMatrix(m_numModules * 2, 3);
072
073    for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
074      m_inverseKinematics.setRow(i * 2 + 0, 0, /* Start Data */ 1, 0, -m_modules[i].getY());
075      m_inverseKinematics.setRow(i * 2 + 1, 0, /* Start Data */ 0, 1, +m_modules[i].getX());
076    }
077    m_forwardKinematics = m_inverseKinematics.pseudoInverse();
078
079    MathSharedStore.reportUsage(MathUsageId.kKinematics_SwerveDrive, 1);
080  }
081
082  /**
083   * Reset the internal swerve module headings.
084   *
085   * @param moduleHeadings The swerve module headings. The order of the module headings should be
086   *     same as passed into the constructor of this class.
087   */
088  public void resetHeadings(Rotation2d... moduleHeadings) {
089    if (moduleHeadings.length != m_numModules) {
090      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
091          "Number of headings is not consistent with number of module locations provided in "
092              + "constructor");
093    }
094    m_moduleHeadings = Arrays.copyOf(moduleHeadings, m_numModules);
095  }
096
097  /**
098   * Performs inverse kinematics to return the module states from a desired chassis velocity. This
099   * method is often used to convert joystick values into module speeds and angles.
100   *
101   * <p>This function also supports variable centers of rotation. During normal operations, the
102   * center of rotation is usually the same as the physical center of the robot; therefore, the
103   * argument is defaulted to that use case. However, if you wish to change the center of rotation
104   * for evasive maneuvers, vision alignment, or for any other use case, you can do so.
105   *
106   * <p>In the case that the desired chassis speeds are zero (i.e. the robot will be stationary),
107   * the previously calculated module angle will be maintained.
108   *
109   * @param chassisSpeeds The desired chassis speed.
110   * @param centerOfRotationMeters The center of rotation. For example, if you set the center of
111   *     rotation at one corner of the robot and provide a chassis speed that only has a dtheta
112   *     component, the robot will rotate around that corner.
113   * @return An array containing the module states. Use caution because these module states are not
114   *     normalized. Sometimes, a user input may cause one of the module speeds to go above the
115   *     attainable max velocity. Use the {@link #desaturateWheelSpeeds(SwerveModuleState[], double)
116   *     DesaturateWheelSpeeds} function to rectify this issue.
117   */
118  public SwerveModuleState[] toSwerveModuleStates(
119      ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds, Translation2d centerOfRotationMeters) {
120    var moduleStates = new SwerveModuleState[m_numModules];
121
122    if (chassisSpeeds.vxMetersPerSecond == 0.0
123        && chassisSpeeds.vyMetersPerSecond == 0.0
124        && chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond == 0.0) {
125      for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
126        moduleStates[i] = new SwerveModuleState(0.0, m_moduleHeadings[i]);
127      }
128
129      return moduleStates;
130    }
131
132    if (!centerOfRotationMeters.equals(m_prevCoR)) {
133      for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
134        m_inverseKinematics.setRow(
135            i * 2 + 0,
136            0, /* Start Data */
137            1,
138            0,
139            -m_modules[i].getY() + centerOfRotationMeters.getY());
140        m_inverseKinematics.setRow(
141            i * 2 + 1,
142            0, /* Start Data */
143            0,
144            1,
145            +m_modules[i].getX() - centerOfRotationMeters.getX());
146      }
147      m_prevCoR = centerOfRotationMeters;
148    }
149
150    var chassisSpeedsVector = new SimpleMatrix(3, 1);
151    chassisSpeedsVector.setColumn(
152        0,
153        0,
154        chassisSpeeds.vxMetersPerSecond,
155        chassisSpeeds.vyMetersPerSecond,
156        chassisSpeeds.omegaRadiansPerSecond);
157
158    var moduleStatesMatrix = m_inverseKinematics.mult(chassisSpeedsVector);
159
160    for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
161      double x = moduleStatesMatrix.get(i * 2, 0);
162      double y = moduleStatesMatrix.get(i * 2 + 1, 0);
163
164      double speed = Math.hypot(x, y);
165      Rotation2d angle = new Rotation2d(x, y);
166
167      moduleStates[i] = new SwerveModuleState(speed, angle);
168      m_moduleHeadings[i] = angle;
169    }
170
171    return moduleStates;
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Performs inverse kinematics. See {@link #toSwerveModuleStates(ChassisSpeeds, Translation2d)}
176   * toSwerveModuleStates for more information.
177   *
178   * @param chassisSpeeds The desired chassis speed.
179   * @return An array containing the module states.
180   */
181  public SwerveModuleState[] toSwerveModuleStates(ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds) {
182    return toSwerveModuleStates(chassisSpeeds, Translation2d.kZero);
183  }
184
185  @Override
186  public SwerveModuleState[] toWheelSpeeds(ChassisSpeeds chassisSpeeds) {
187    return toSwerveModuleStates(chassisSpeeds);
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * Performs forward kinematics to return the resulting chassis state from the given module states.
192   * This method is often used for odometry -- determining the robot's position on the field using
193   * data from the real-world speed and angle of each module on the robot.
194   *
195   * @param moduleStates The state of the modules (as a SwerveModuleState type) as measured from
196   *     respective encoders and gyros. The order of the swerve module states should be same as
197   *     passed into the constructor of this class.
198   * @return The resulting chassis speed.
199   */
200  @Override
201  public ChassisSpeeds toChassisSpeeds(SwerveModuleState... moduleStates) {
202    if (moduleStates.length != m_numModules) {
203      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
204          "Number of modules is not consistent with number of module locations provided in "
205              + "constructor");
206    }
207    var moduleStatesMatrix = new SimpleMatrix(m_numModules * 2, 1);
208
209    for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
210      var module = moduleStates[i];
211      moduleStatesMatrix.set(i * 2, 0, module.speedMetersPerSecond * module.angle.getCos());
212      moduleStatesMatrix.set(i * 2 + 1, module.speedMetersPerSecond * module.angle.getSin());
213    }
214
215    var chassisSpeedsVector = m_forwardKinematics.mult(moduleStatesMatrix);
216    return new ChassisSpeeds(
217        chassisSpeedsVector.get(0, 0),
218        chassisSpeedsVector.get(1, 0),
219        chassisSpeedsVector.get(2, 0));
220  }
221
222  /**
223   * Performs forward kinematics to return the resulting chassis state from the given module states.
224   * This method is often used for odometry -- determining the robot's position on the field using
225   * data from the real-world speed and angle of each module on the robot.
226   *
227   * @param moduleDeltas The latest change in position of the modules (as a SwerveModulePosition
228   *     type) as measured from respective encoders and gyros. The order of the swerve module states
229   *     should be same as passed into the constructor of this class.
230   * @return The resulting Twist2d.
231   */
232  public Twist2d toTwist2d(SwerveModulePosition... moduleDeltas) {
233    if (moduleDeltas.length != m_numModules) {
234      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
235          "Number of modules is not consistent with number of module locations provided in "
236              + "constructor");
237    }
238    var moduleDeltaMatrix = new SimpleMatrix(m_numModules * 2, 1);
239
240    for (int i = 0; i < m_numModules; i++) {
241      var module = moduleDeltas[i];
242      moduleDeltaMatrix.set(i * 2, 0, module.distanceMeters * module.angle.getCos());
243      moduleDeltaMatrix.set(i * 2 + 1, module.distanceMeters * module.angle.getSin());
244    }
245
246    var chassisDeltaVector = m_forwardKinematics.mult(moduleDeltaMatrix);
247    return new Twist2d(
248        chassisDeltaVector.get(0, 0), chassisDeltaVector.get(1, 0), chassisDeltaVector.get(2, 0));
249  }
250
251  @Override
252  public Twist2d toTwist2d(SwerveModulePosition[] start, SwerveModulePosition[] end) {
253    if (start.length != end.length) {
254      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Inconsistent number of modules!");
255    }
256    var newPositions = new SwerveModulePosition[start.length];
257    for (int i = 0; i < start.length; i++) {
258      newPositions[i] =
259          new SwerveModulePosition(end[i].distanceMeters - start[i].distanceMeters, end[i].angle);
260    }
261    return toTwist2d(newPositions);
262  }
263
264  /**
265   * Renormalizes the wheel speeds if any individual speed is above the specified maximum.
266   *
267   * <p>Sometimes, after inverse kinematics, the requested speed from one or more modules may be
268   * above the max attainable speed for the driving motor on that module. To fix this issue, one can
269   * reduce all the wheel speeds to make sure that all requested module speeds are at-or-below the
270   * absolute threshold, while maintaining the ratio of speeds between modules.
271   *
272   * @param moduleStates Reference to array of module states. The array will be mutated with the
273   *     normalized speeds!
274   * @param attainableMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond The absolute max speed that a module can reach.
275   */
276  public static void desaturateWheelSpeeds(
277      SwerveModuleState[] moduleStates, double attainableMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond) {
278    double realMaxSpeed = 0;
279    for (SwerveModuleState moduleState : moduleStates) {
280      realMaxSpeed = Math.max(realMaxSpeed, Math.abs(moduleState.speedMetersPerSecond));
281    }
282    if (realMaxSpeed > attainableMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond) {
283      for (SwerveModuleState moduleState : moduleStates) {
284        moduleState.speedMetersPerSecond =
285            moduleState.speedMetersPerSecond / realMaxSpeed * attainableMaxSpeedMetersPerSecond;
286      }
287    }
288  }
289
290  /**
291   * Renormalizes the wheel speeds if any individual speed is above the specified maximum.
292   *
293   * <p>Sometimes, after inverse kinematics, the requested speed from one or more modules may be
294   * above the max attainable speed for the driving motor on that module. To fix this issue, one can
295   * reduce all the wheel speeds to make sure that all requested module speeds are at-or-below the
296   * absolute threshold, while maintaining the ratio of speeds between modules.
297   *
298   * @param moduleStates Reference to array of module states. The array will be mutated with the
299   *     normalized speeds!
300   * @param attainableMaxSpeed The absolute max speed that a module can reach.
301   */
302  public static void desaturateWheelSpeeds(
303      SwerveModuleState[] moduleStates, Measure<Velocity<Distance>> attainableMaxSpeed) {
304    desaturateWheelSpeeds(moduleStates, attainableMaxSpeed.in(MetersPerSecond));
305  }
306
307  /**
308   * Renormalizes the wheel speeds if any individual speed is above the specified maximum, as well
309   * as getting rid of joystick saturation at edges of joystick.
310   *
311   * <p>Sometimes, after inverse kinematics, the requested speed from one or more modules may be
312   * above the max attainable speed for the driving motor on that module. To fix this issue, one can
313   * reduce all the wheel speeds to make sure that all requested module speeds are at-or-below the
314   * absolute threshold, while maintaining the ratio of speeds between modules.
315   *
316   * @param moduleStates Reference to array of module states. The array will be mutated with the
317   *     normalized speeds!
318   * @param desiredChassisSpeed The desired speed of the robot
319   * @param attainableMaxModuleSpeedMetersPerSecond The absolute max speed that a module can reach
320   * @param attainableMaxTranslationalSpeedMetersPerSecond The absolute max speed that your robot
321   *     can reach while translating
322   * @param attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond The absolute max speed the robot can
323   *     reach while rotating
324   */
325  public static void desaturateWheelSpeeds(
326      SwerveModuleState[] moduleStates,
327      ChassisSpeeds desiredChassisSpeed,
328      double attainableMaxModuleSpeedMetersPerSecond,
329      double attainableMaxTranslationalSpeedMetersPerSecond,
330      double attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond) {
331    double realMaxSpeed = 0;
332    for (SwerveModuleState moduleState : moduleStates) {
333      realMaxSpeed = Math.max(realMaxSpeed, Math.abs(moduleState.speedMetersPerSecond));
334    }
335
336    if (attainableMaxTranslationalSpeedMetersPerSecond == 0
337        || attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond == 0
338        || realMaxSpeed == 0) {
339      return;
340    }
341    double translationalK =
342        Math.hypot(desiredChassisSpeed.vxMetersPerSecond, desiredChassisSpeed.vyMetersPerSecond)
343            / attainableMaxTranslationalSpeedMetersPerSecond;
344    double rotationalK =
345        Math.abs(desiredChassisSpeed.omegaRadiansPerSecond)
346            / attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond;
347    double k = Math.max(translationalK, rotationalK);
348    double scale = Math.min(k * attainableMaxModuleSpeedMetersPerSecond / realMaxSpeed, 1);
349    for (SwerveModuleState moduleState : moduleStates) {
350      moduleState.speedMetersPerSecond *= scale;
351    }
352  }
353
354  /**
355   * Renormalizes the wheel speeds if any individual speed is above the specified maximum, as well
356   * as getting rid of joystick saturation at edges of joystick.
357   *
358   * <p>Sometimes, after inverse kinematics, the requested speed from one or more modules may be
359   * above the max attainable speed for the driving motor on that module. To fix this issue, one can
360   * reduce all the wheel speeds to make sure that all requested module speeds are at-or-below the
361   * absolute threshold, while maintaining the ratio of speeds between modules.
362   *
363   * @param moduleStates Reference to array of module states. The array will be mutated with the
364   *     normalized speeds!
365   * @param desiredChassisSpeed The desired speed of the robot
366   * @param attainableMaxModuleSpeed The absolute max speed that a module can reach
367   * @param attainableMaxTranslationalSpeed The absolute max speed that your robot can reach while
368   *     translating
369   * @param attainableMaxRotationalVelocity The absolute max speed the robot can reach while
370   *     rotating
371   */
372  public static void desaturateWheelSpeeds(
373      SwerveModuleState[] moduleStates,
374      ChassisSpeeds desiredChassisSpeed,
375      Measure<Velocity<Distance>> attainableMaxModuleSpeed,
376      Measure<Velocity<Distance>> attainableMaxTranslationalSpeed,
377      Measure<Velocity<Angle>> attainableMaxRotationalVelocity) {
378    desaturateWheelSpeeds(
379        moduleStates,
380        desiredChassisSpeed,
381        attainableMaxModuleSpeed.in(MetersPerSecond),
382        attainableMaxTranslationalSpeed.in(MetersPerSecond),
383        attainableMaxRotationalVelocity.in(RadiansPerSecond));
384  }
385
386  @Override
387  public SwerveModulePosition[] copy(SwerveModulePosition[] positions) {
388    var newPositions = new SwerveModulePosition[positions.length];
389    for (int i = 0; i < positions.length; ++i) {
390      newPositions[i] = positions[i].copy();
391    }
392    return newPositions;
393  }
394
395  @Override
396  public SwerveModulePosition[] interpolate(
397      SwerveModulePosition[] startValue, SwerveModulePosition[] endValue, double t) {
398    if (endValue.length != startValue.length) {
399      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Inconsistent number of modules!");
400    }
401    var newPositions = new SwerveModulePosition[startValue.length];
402    for (int i = 0; i < startValue.length; ++i) {
403      newPositions[i] = startValue[i].interpolate(endValue[i], t);
404    }
405    return newPositions;
406  }
407}
